title: Blackstone poaches Brookfield young gun for private equity
text:
Global alternative asset management heavyweight Blackstone has poached a Brookfield Capital Partners dealmaker for its Australian private equity team.

Fresh from celebrating its 10-year anniversary in Australia, it is understood Blackstone has recruited Prakash Rajah to work in its local buyout practice under senior managing director James Carnegie.

Blackstone has bolstered its team of dealmakers in Australia. Bloomberg

It comes soon after Blackstone principal Christian Keiber joined the firm's Australian buyout team as Carnegie's 2ic after relocating from the Singapore office.

Rajah was an up-and-coming dealmaker at Brookfield Capital Partners, which is the private equity arm of Canadian firm Brookfield Asset Management.

He was involved in the firm's purchase and sale of a stake in Quadrant Energy and its acquisition of private hospital operator Healthscope, which is the biggest private equity deal in Australia this year.
